SEARCH
Package com.example.fusion0.helpers

Class GeoLocation

java.lang.Object
com.example.fusion0.helpers.GeoLocation
public class GeoLocation extends Object
GeoLocation class manages the user's geolocation, calculates distances to an event location, and determines whether the user can register based on an acceptable radius.
Author:
Derin Karas

    • GeoLocation

      public GeoLocation(FragmentActivity fragmentActivity, Context context, double eventLatitude, double eventLongitude, double acceptableRadius)
      Constructor with event details.
      Parameters:
      fragmentActivity - The activity context to display dialogs.
      context - The context in which the location service is accessed.
      eventLatitude - The latitude of the event location.
      eventLongitude - The longitude of the event location.
      acceptableRadius - The radius within which the user can register.

  • Method Details

    • onLocationChanged

      public void onLocationChanged(Location location)
      Callback method invoked when the user's location changes. Updates userLocation and displays a Toast message.
      Parameters:
      location - The new location of the user.

    • isLocationPermissionGranted

      public boolean isLocationPermissionGranted()
      Checks if location permissions are granted. Requests permissions if not already granted and returns false immediately. The actual result (granted or denied) should be handled in onRequestPermissionsResult.
      Returns:
      true if location permission is already granted; false if permission is requested.

    • requestLocationPermission

      public void requestLocationPermission()
      Requests location permission from the user if it isn’t already granted.

    • getLocation

      public Location getLocation()
      Attempts to retrieve the user's current location. If location permissions are granted, it first tries to retrieve the last known location from the GPS provider. If a last known location is available, it is returned immediately. If no last known location is available, it requests location updates from both the GPS and Network providers to obtain the user's location. Location updates will trigger the `onLocationChanged` method when a new location is available. If permissions are not granted or the user has denied the request, it will not attempt to retrieve the location and returns null.
      Returns:
      the user's last known location if available, or null if no immediate location is available or permissions are not granted.

    • canRegister

      public boolean canRegister()
      Determines if the user can register based on their distance from the event location.
      Returns:
      true if the user is within the acceptable radius from the event location; false otherwise.

    • setEventLocation

      public void setEventLocation(double latitude, double longitude)
      Sets the event location based on provided latitude and longitude.
      Parameters:
      latitude - The latitude of the event location.
      longitude - The longitude of the event location.

      longitude - The longitude of the user location.
